result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan J. Basham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Logan J. Basham appeared with Attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances.  Also has 15 CF 97, and 15 CF 111.  State speaks to the court.  Atty Murtaugh speaks to the court. Court speaks to the def. re: his plea questionaire and waiver of rights form. Court finds that the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court finds there is a factual basis. State speaks to the court.

15 CF 17
Count 1-Def. pleas guilty, court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty.

15 CF 97
Count 1-Def. pleas guilty, court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. 

All other counts in the cases dismissed.
15 CF 111-Dismissed 

3 years probation concurrent w/ both case. Condition 30 days jail in 15 CF 17. + any credit + costs.  Report to jail on or before 12/22/15 @ 4pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Logan J. Basham appeared with Attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State.   Court calls case and appearances.  State calls Officer Mike Kronberger to the stand. Clerk swears in Officer Kronberger.  State questions Officer Kronberger.  Court finds that the officer has identifed the defendant.  State continues questioning.  No further questions from the state.  Cross examination from Atty Murtaugh.  No futher questions. Witness is excused.  Court finds there is probable cause. 

Court notes the B. Harrington was a part of this case.  Court recuses.  
Court notes information has been filed. Bail will continue.

Defendant, Logan J. Basham appeared with Attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Not to consume any alcohol.  Not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed doctor.  Curfew from 9:30 pm to 5:15 am.  Must be at residence lised
